content.description: Climb the crack just next to the throne to tower over and become THE USURPER.
content.protection: This is a bit of a highball, you're likely gonna want to have a good pad and some spotters.
content.location: The crack just to the right of "Ascend the Throne," at the right side of Kittle Rocks.

content.description: Very short route that goes up a crack but has some nice jugs on either side on the way up.
content.protection: The pine tree at the top has been lashed with metal cable to set up an anchor from, or set your own around the tree. Trad also an option.
content.location: Pretty far to the right compared to the other roped routes, the easiest way to find this route is the spray painted STZ in black and red letters to the left of the crack. There is a pine tree right as you top out here too.

content.description: This is a super fun route. The crack turns from finger jams at the bottom, to a full on chimney at the top that feels like it is chewing on you and spitting you out simultaneously. About 1/3 of the way up is a nice little ledge to rest on that we call "Asscheek Ledge," as it is just barely big enough to sit on.
content.protection: 2 bolts at the top or a crack to run trad pro in. Bring at least one c4 cam or bigger for the chimney near the top, else you'll be running it out uncomfortably far.
content.location: Farthest left crack that goes all the way up at Kittle Rocks.

content.description: Climb a crack to about 10 ft up, then work your way up the arete to the left of Pussy Crack. Gets kinda tough towards the top and occasionally you may have to pop a leg over into The Chimaney to have a proper rest.
content.protection: Use the bolts from The Chimaney or Pussy Crack
content.location: Just to the left of Pussy Crack, kinda obvious if you are familiar with female anatomy.
see the beta video in the comments

content.description: Climb an easy wide crack with good jugs up to The Throne.
content.location: Towards the right side of Kittle Rocks. This part is almost a stand-alone column of basalt about 12 feet tall.

content.description: Fun climb that tends to contort the climber in strange positions as a semi-chimney to the right allows for some stemming, but precariously.
content.protection: Use the bolts from Pussy Crack
content.location: Just to the right of Pussy Crack. blah blah female anatomy.

content.description: this one is fun. start on tiny little crimps with terrible feet. move right and up. a sneaky bar can help you through the large crack just to the right of the start. the last few moves are pretty easy but are above a rock that would be painful to fall onto
content.protection: A few pads and maybe a couple spotters
content.location: nearly the farthest rock left at railroad level. see the beta video in the comments

content.description: This is the first route we started with at Kittle Rocks. This route is easy and fun as heck if you are good at crack climbing. It cruxes about 10 feet down from the top at a spot we affectionately refer to as "The Clit." The bolts at the top can be accessed by walking around the cliff to the right.
content.protection: A good crack running all the way up to sink trad pro into, or there are 2 bolts at the top to set up a top rope anchor.
content.location: Near to the left end of the cliff, where the tall parts are. Easy to find because of the "I (heart) PUSSY" in green spray paint at the bottom. Hence the name of the route.

content.description: Pretty hard route that works its way up a tiny crack that widens out to hand jams at the top. It is pretty pumpy, I will occasionally jump over to ShitBalls on the left halfway up the route for a proper rest.
content.protection: Trad pro in the crack or use the bolts from ShitBalls.
content.location: The crack just to the right of ShitBalls and to the left of The Chimaney.

content.description: crux is midway through with a right slap out to a sloper, then a left pinch
content.location: has the words "bad juju" graffiti'd at the bottom. see video in comments.

content.description: Short, easy route. Crux is close to the bottom, about 10 feet up where the rock gets a little rotten.
content.location: The crack just to the left of the RW18 graffiti tag

content.description: Not much of a crack on this route, so be prepared to use those fingertips! The crux is about 2/3 up where either side becomes very blank and the crack only barely fits your fingers.
content.location: Start up at the base of the Chimaney. The crack and route is very obvious in the pics

content.description: Pretty easy climb up a chimney that slenders as you go up. Good jugs most of the way, and you can always just stem your legs in a pinch. The routes name is purposely pronounced "chim-uh-knee" like the weird way that some people pronounce that word. This is important.
content.location: Wide chimney located just to the left of Pussy Crack.

content.description: start with super low hands and leaned back
content.location: the face just to the right of the "Stza Crack" see beta video in comments
see the video in the comments

content.description: crux is the super compressed starting move
content.location: see the video in the comments

content.description: Pretty easy problem up to a nice seat. Small feet and wide hands transition to slopey ledges. Quick problem if you can dyno to the ledges!
content.location: Towards the right side of Kittle Rocks. This part is almost a stand-alone column of basalt about 12 feet tall.

content.description: This route follows the crack just to the left of ShitBalls that ends on a big ledge about halfway up. Climb the arete above the ledge for the last ~20 ft of the climb.
content.protection: Use the bolts from ShitBalls, just manage your rope carefully as you get towards the top
content.location: The farthest left crack at Kittle Rocks that doesn't go all the way up. There is a rock a little bigger than the size of a bread box on the ground that can be stood on to start this route.
